answer_to_complaint.description: Answer must be filed by 10:00 AM on the Monday next after the expiration of 20 days after service of citation (TRCP § 99)
exceptions: If Monday is a legal holiday, deadline is Tuesday
Extended for defendants served outside Texas

motion_to_dismiss.description: Special Exception or Motion to Dismiss should be filed before or with answer
exceptions: May be filed later with leave of court
Must be filed before trial to preserve error

interrogatories.description: Response to interrogatories must be served within 30 days after service (TRCP § 197.2)

requests_for_admission.description: Response to requests for admission must be served within 30 days (TRCP § 198.2)

deposition_notice.description: Notice of deposition must be served at least 10 days before deposition (TRCP § 199.2)

motion_filing.description: Non-dispositive motions require 3 days notice; dispositive motions require 21 days (TRCP § 21a)
exceptions: Extended by 3 days if served by mail
Emergency motions may be heard on shorter notice

appeal_deadline.description: Notice of Appeal must be filed within 30 days after judgment is signed (TRAP § 26.1)

notice_period.description: Ex parte applications generally require reasonable notice unless immediate irreparable harm is shown

filing_time.description: Ex parte applications typically heard at morning docket call

requirements: Verified petition or affidavit showing specific facts of immediate harm
Certificate of conference or explanation of why notice should not be required
Motion showing personal service cannot be made with reasonable diligence
Court order specifying method of substituted service
Service as directed by court order

service_by_mail.description: Service by mail extends response time by 3 days (TRCP § 21a)

electronic_service.description: Electronic service extends response time by 3 days (TRCP § 21a)

court_fees.fee_waiver_form: Statement of Inability to Afford Payment of Court Costs
